snippet: Chinese state-run newspapers are questioning Japan’s sovereignty over the island, the latest sign of growing nationalism and territorial ambitions among China’s elite.
abstract: Chinese state-run newspapers are questioning Japan’s sovereignty over island of Okinawa, latest sign of growing nationalism and territorial ambitions among China’s elite.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue in Tokyo and Patrick Zuo in Beijing contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Chinese state-run newspapers are questioning Japan’s sovereignty over the island, the latest sign of growing nationalism and territorial ambitions among China’s elite.
